content:
The bassline in "Another One Bites the Dust" is a highly recognizable and iconic component of the song's energetic groove. The bassline is characterized by its repeating pattern that moves between the tonic note and the dominant note in a syncopated rhythm. This creates a sense of tension and release that serves to drive the song forward, giving it a strong sense of momentum.

The bassline also provides a solid foundation for the other instruments in the song to build upon, creating a cohesive and powerful sound that is both driving and danceable. It is the anchor upon which the song's energetic groove is built, and its catchy and memorable melody has helped to make "Another One Bites the Dust" one of the most beloved and memorable hits of the 1980s.
